importantArticles.headline: TAIPEI (Reuters) -Advanced Micro Devices said on Tuesday its key processor chips would soon be made at TSMC's new production site in Arizona, marking the first time that its products will be manufactured in the United States.  Though AMD's plans predate U.S. President Donald Trump's return to office, tech companies' efforts to diversify their supply chains have taken on added significance given Trump's escalating tariff war.  "Our new fifth-generation EPYC is doing very well, so we're ready to start production," AMD Chief Executive Lisa Su told reporters in Taipei, referring to the company's central processing unit (CPU) for data centres.
importantArticles.title: AMD set to produce its CPU chip at TSMC plant in Arizona

importantArticles.headline: Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ: AMD) stock saw a day of big sell-offs Thursday.  The semiconductor company's share price wound up down 8.4% in a day of trading that saw the S&P 500 fall 3.5% and the Nasdaq Composite fall 4.4%.  The stock market followed Wednesday's surge on tariff news with substantial sell-offs today as more information about import taxes on China came into focus.
